newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Demonstrators suspend Czech nuclear plant protest.
newsitem.headline: Demonstrators suspend Czech nuclear plant protest.

text.p: Czech environmentalists trying to block construction of a controversial Soviet-designed nuclear power station since Sunday have suspended their action for at least a day because of rain and cold winds, the CTK news agency said on Monday.
About 450 Czechs and foreign nationals were trying to

block the main road outside the site of the Temelin station, where construction began before the end of communist rule in 1989. The new plant is expected to open by the end of the century, its design upgraded with control systems from U.S. Westinghouse Electrical.
Police trying to clear the road have had occasional confrontations with protestors, but there have been no reports of major violence.
Environmentalists and the government in nearby Austria argue the plant is dangerous and unnecessary.
